action.action-desc: Mr. Thompson of Mississippi (for himself and Mr. Carter of Louisiana) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Post-Katrina Emergency Management Reform Act of 2006 to set training requirements on eligibility for certain emergency management performance grants, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Emergency Management Support Act or the EMS Act.

subsection.text: Section 661 of the Post-Katrina Emergency Management Reform Act of 2006 (6 U.S.C. 762) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1) by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (2) by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: the term local emergency management director means an official designated at the local level to coordinate local disaster response, emergency planning, emergency preparedness, disaster recovery, disaster mitigation, and related activities on a full-time or part-time basis.
by inserting after subsection (e) the following:

subsection.text: To be eligible to receive a grant under this section—

subparagraph.text: require local emergency management directors to successfully complete Federal Emergency Management Agency provided baseline emergency management training developed in accordance with the National Incident Management System—

clause.text: not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this subsection; and
recurrently at an interval determined by the Administrator to strengthen local emergency management capacity; and

subparagraph.text: submit certifications to the Administrator annually as directed by the Administrator regarding compliance with the requirements in paragraph (1); or

paragraph.text: with respect to a State that cannot certify that all local emergency management directors have completed training required under paragraph (1)(A), a State shall submit a certification that includes—

subparagraph.text: an identification of all barriers to achieving the baseline emergency management training requirement; and
an approach to overcoming barriers identified under subparagraph (A) with an anticipated timeline for full compliance with the baseline emergency management training requirement.
by striking There is and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: There is authorized to be appropriated such sums as are necessary to carry out subsection (f).

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency shall submit to Congress a report on compliance with the amendments made by this Act.
